criteria: Accuracy in determining the unknown whole number.
Demonstrates understanding of the relationship between addition and subtraction.
Ability to solve equations with the unknown on either side of the equal sign.
descriptions: Student is unable to identify the unknown number in any of the equations.
Student can identify the unknown number in simple addition equations (e.g., 8 + ? = 11) but struggles with subtraction or equations with the unknown on the left side.
Student can identify the unknown number in simple addition and subtraction equations but makes frequent errors.
Student can accurately determine the unknown number in most addition and subtraction equations, including those with the unknown on either side of the equation.
Student consistently and accurately determines the unknown number in a variety of addition and subtraction equations, demonstrating a strong understanding of the relationship between the numbers.
Student demonstrates a complete understanding of addition and subtraction equations and can fluently and accurately determine the unknown number in complex equations, and explains the strategy used.
Student does not show any understanding of how addition and subtraction are related.
Student shows limited awareness of the inverse relationship between addition and subtraction.
Student recognizes that addition and subtraction are related but struggles to apply this understanding to find the unknown number.
Student understands the relationship between addition and subtraction and uses this understanding to solve for the unknown in most cases.
Student clearly demonstrates the inverse relationship between addition and subtraction and uses it to efficiently solve for the unknown number.
Student can explain the inverse relationship between addition and subtraction in detail and use it to solve complex problems, and teach it to other students.
Student is unable to solve equations where the unknown is on the left side (e.g., 5 = ? - 3).
Student attempts to solve equations with the unknown on the left side but struggles to correctly apply the operation.
Student can solve simple equations with the unknown on either side but makes errors in more complex problems.
Student can solve most equations with the unknown on either side of the equal sign with reasonable accuracy.
Student consistently solves equations with the unknown on either side of the equal sign accurately and efficiently.
Student solves all equations regardless of the unknown placement and provides explanations of steps.
